title: Pitsford Reservoir Walk Route

images.title: Will Lovell / Pitsford Water Nature Reserve
images.caption: Pitsford Water Nature Reserve. Looking west across the Scaldwell arm of the reservoir from a track around the perimeter. Access to this part of the reservoir is by permit only, obtainable from the Fishing Lodge at the Holcot end of the causeway.

images.title: Brian Turner / Balloons over Pitsford Reservoir
images.caption: Balloons over Pitsford Reservoir. The reservoir was built in 1956 to supply the town of Northampton, which is about 6 miles to the south. It is the largest body of water in the county.

images.title: Kokai / Dam
images.caption: Dam at the end of Pitsford Water. Taken from the South East end. The reservoir spillway is in the foreground.

images.title: Kokai / Pitsford Water
images.caption: Nice view over the water in late summer

images.title: The White Swan, Holcot by Bikeboy, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The White Swan, Holcot. The small village is located east of the water and includes this fine old pub.

images.title: Pitsford reservoir causeway by James Allan, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Reservoir causeway

images.title: Kokai / Brixworth Country Park
images.caption: Brixworth Country Park. Seen from the picnic area looking NNE.

images.title: Kokai / Shoreline of Reservoir
images.caption: Shoreline of Reservoir. The shoreline referred to in the title is bottom right of the image. Yachts on Pitsford Water can be seen in the distance.

description: This circular walk takes you around the lovely Pitsford Reservoir in Brixworth Northamptonshire. The waterside trail runs for just over 6 miles on a nice flat, surfaced path. It will probably take around 3-4 hours to complete the circuit. Start the walk from the car park and visitor centre at Brixworth Country Park on the western side of the water. Then head east to the village of Holcot where you cross the water on the causeway. Other paths will then take you along the northern edge of the water to the car park. The area is designated as a nature reserve so you can look out for a variety of wildlife on the way. Keep your eyes peeled for Northern Shoveler, Little egrets, Great crested grebes and Goldeneye as you make your way through this lovely area. The site is located close to both Northampton and Wellingborough .
